title: MORAL RESPONSIBILITY AND THE PROBLEM OF MANY HANDS
description: Author: Ibo van de Poel, Lambèr Royakkers, Sjoerd D. Zwart Edition: 1 edition Publication Date: March 19, 2015 Publisher: Routledge ISBN-10: 1138838551 ISBN-13: 978-1138838550 Pages: 238 pages Format: pdf Size: 1.2M --- When many people are involved in an activity, it is often difficult, if not impossible, to pinpoint who is morally responsible for what, a phenomenon known as the ‘problem of many hands.’ This term is increasingly used to describe problems with attributing individual responsibility in collective settings in such diverse areas as public administration, corporate management, law and regulation, technological development and innovation, healthcare, and finance. --- http://dlfeb.com/book/moral-responsibility-and-problem-of-many-hands-routledge-studies-in-ethics-and-moral-theory/
